title: Darigold Butter Lettering - Custom?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225163526im_/http:/typophile.com/files/butter6_6288.gif)

I’ve been eyeing the lettering from butter labels for a while, and I finally found the one I was looking for. I’ve seen the lettering for ’BUTTER’ on other grocer house butters, and I just realized it was originally Darigold. Wondering from the type experts around here if this is a custom face (i’m assuming) or if this is derived from anything else. I’d like to create an alphabet from the lettering on the pre-80s packages, I think it’s wonderful.

Thanks!

More on Darigold labels:  
 [http://www.darigold.com/butterlabels.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225163526/http:/www.darigold.com/butterlabels.asp "http://www.darigold.com/butterlabels.asp")

 [‹ (x) Distressed grotesque from Tazo Teas website - Faxfont {Sean Glenn}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225163526/http:/typophile.com/node/38251 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Flow" classic caps w/ large serifs - Stetson {Mike E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225163526/http:/typophile.com/node/38334 "Go to next forum topic")
author: waves

comments.content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/mwproductions/305235946/in/set-721575943902...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225163526/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/mwproductions/305235946/in/set-72157594390298055/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/mwproductions/305235946/in/set-72157594390298055/")

OK, looks like the same lettering was used on numerous Darigold packaging back in the day. Maybe this brand is just a NW thing, I might take a drive out to Yakima (2hrs east of Seattle) to see the cheese factory and investigate.
